The President has shown a willingness to come to the table multiple times throughout this process and now Democrats must do the same.
As we continue to negotiate over the next three weeks, I urge the Democrats to change their tune and send a bill containing wall funding to President Trump’s desk.

The people of PA-13 are tired of kicking the can down the road when it comes to securing our border and do not understand why Democrats, who have supported physical barriers in the past, refuse to offer a single dollar for the wall.
The reason that the people of our district sent me to Washington is simple: they are fed up with politics as usual.

Our prayers are that we can move forward peacefully to the common goals of life, liberty and the pursuit of happiness.
Today, we honor the life and legacy of Dr. Martin Luther King Jr. Dr. King reminded us that we are all God's children and that we are all created equal as human beings.
I call on Speaker Pelosi to stop the endless obstruction and begin good faith negotiations so we can get back to work for the American people.
It seems that nothing will satisfy the Democrats in these negotiations and that they will continue to hold federal workers hostage for the sole purpose of trying to stop President Trump's agenda.
To review - President Trump is offering Democrats immigration reforms that they want, and border security that they voted for in the past, but today they are backing away from both.
Time and time again throughout the shutdown, President Trump has shown a willingness to compromise so we can secure our border and reopen the government.
I call on Speaker Pelosi to begin good faith negotiations so we can secure the border and bring an end to the shutdown. My full statement is here -> pic.twitter.com/GA06rA87As

Today I voted to guarantee back pay to federal employees who are bearing the burden of this shutdown. Many of them will miss their first paycheck today because Democrats refuse to negotiate. I am fighting to reopen the government and will decline my salary until that happens.

To my colleagues across the aisle who supported wall funding in the past – what changed? 

Are you really willing to reverse a previous position and keep government closed just so you can resist the President’s agenda?

It’s time to fund the wall and bring an end to the shutdown. pic.twitter.com/ylQshwlZAJ
